thread.title: Trek to the summit
thread.title_full: Trek to the summit - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Trek to the summit
text:
Photo: Fred Thornhill Image 1 of / 2 2 Toronto Blue Jays pitcher David Price throws against the Texas Rangers in the first inning of Game 1 of the American League Division Series in Toronto on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Fred Thornhill/Pool Photo via AP) ORG XMIT: FJT03 Toronto Blue Jays pitcher David Price throws against the Texas Rangers in the first inning of Game 1 of the American League Division Series in Toronto on Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015. (Fred Thornhill/Pool Photo via ... more Image 2 of 2 CHICAGO, IL - OCTOBER 21: Daniel Murphy #28 of the New York Mets hits a two run home run in the eighth inning against Fernando Rodney #57 of the Chicago Cubs during game four of the 2015 MLB National League Championship Series at Wrigley Field on October 21, 2015 in Chicago, Illinois. (Photo by Elsa/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 586012911 CHICAGO, IL - OCTOBER 21: Daniel Murphy #28 of the New York Mets hits a two run home run in the eighth inning against Fernando Rodney #57 of the Chicago Cubs during game four of the 2015 MLB National League ... more Trek to the summit 1 / 2 Back to Gallery New York
In the 1960s, the idea of the Mets winning a World Series was as farfetched as man walking on the moon. Just 88 days after Neil Armstrong took his giant leap, the Amazins were champions.
Now Tyler Clippard is convinced an extraterrestrial has led the Mets back to the Fall Classic.
"He's not human. He's not on this planet right now," Clippard said about Daniel Murphy . "Another life form jumped into his body."
Heading into a World Series matchup that opens in Kansas City or Toronto on Tuesday night, it seems as if it is in the stars whenever the Mets are successful.
In 1969, there were hard-to-fathom catches by Tommy Agee and Ron Swoboda in the Series against Baltimore. Cleon Jones reached first base on a hit batsman call during a Game 5 rally when manager Gil Hodges showed a ball with shoe polish to an umpire.
More Information
World Series
All games televised on Fox-23
Game 1: Tuesday: at Toronto or Kansas City
Game 2: Wednesday: at Toronto or Kansas City
Game 3: Oct. 30: at N.Y. Mets
Game 4: Oct. 31: at N.Y. Mets
x-Game 5: Nov. 1: at N.Y. Mets
x-Game 6: Nov. 3: at Toronto or Kansas City
x-Game 7: Nov. 4: at Toronto or Kansas City
x-if necessary
In 1986, there was Mookie Wilson 's grounder that went through Bill Buckner 's legs at first base to cap a three-run, 10th-inning rally in Game 6 against Boston after the Mets were twice down to their season's final strike.
Now there's Murphy, who has seven home runs in nine playoff games, setting a major-league record by going deep in each of his past six.
"This is special. This is special. I can't stop saying it," captain David Wright exclaimed. "The '69 Mets, the '86 Mets, the 2000 Mets â€” we are amongst the best Mets teams to ever play, and I couldn't be more proud."
The Mets are back in the Series led by a brash young pitching staff that includes the Dark Knight ( Matt Harvey ), Thor (Noah Syndergaard), the deGrominator (Jacob deGrom) and Steven Matz , a group whose 147 regular-season career starts easily would be the fewest for a Series foursome.
Mets manager Terry Collins had not led a major-league team since 1999, when was hired before the 2011 season. Now 66, the oldest manager in the major leagues, he had skippered 1,688 regular-season games before advancing to the Series for the first time.
"I'm sitting there tonight thinking, holy crap, now you're in it after all these years," Collins said. "It was worth the wait. It was worth all the work."
